intro: Gnaphalium longifolium, commonly known as the slender everlasting or longleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in dense, rounded clusters. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, meadows, and along stream banks. Gnaphalium longifolium is often used in floral arrangements due to its delicate, long-lasting flowers.
